item.title: Postdoctoral researcher in bacterial genome editing
item.description:
The Systems Biology of Host-Microbiome Interactions group is recruiting a postdoctoral researcher to work in the ERC-funded project “Transcriptional REGUlation as a mediator of bacterial interactions in the microBIOME” (Project 101116482 - REGUBIOME - ERC-StG-2023). This project aims to reveal the gene regulatory networks of specific health-associated bacteria from the human gut microbiome, to understand how external stimuli lead to changes in their gene expression, influencing their interactions with the rest of the gut ecosystem.

The project will be developed at the Centro de Investigación Príncipe Felipe (CIPF) in Valencia, Spain, a leading biomedical institute developing competitive and internationally relevant research in the fields of metabolic disorders, cancer and neuronal pathologies. The research centre, located in Valencia, occupies an area of 32,000m2 and it is equipped with the most advanced infraestructures, facilities and technological equipment.

Responsibilities and qualifications

In this role, you will be developing genome editing tools for health-associated bacteria in the gut microbiome, and coupling high-throughput genome editing with screening experiments to reconstruct the gene regulatory networks of these bacteria.

Your roles will involve:

  • Developing genetic tools for the manipulation of anaerobic bacteria

  • Designing and performing large-scale genome-editing screens

  • Performing high-throughput transcriptomic screens in the mutants generated

  • Supervision of BSc and MSc students involved in the project

  • Active participation in accomplishing the milestones and deliverables of the project

Your qualifications are:

  • Required degree: the candidate must have a PhD in microbiology, molecular biology, biotechnology or related disciplines

  • Experience in bacterial genome editing

  • Strong knowledge of (gut) bacterial physiology

  • Excellent communication skills in written and spoken English

In addition, the following will be considered:

  • Experience in programming with R and/or Python

  • Experience in transcriptomics analyses

  • Experience in working with anaerobic bacteria

What we offer:

We offer a full time contract for 2.5 years, fully funded by the ERC project REGUBIOME (ERC StG 2023, project 101116482). Salary level follows CIPF salary scales for postdoctoral researchers (R2 category), in agreement with the corresponding collective agreement (Convenio de la Sanidad Privada de la Provincia de Valencia).

The CIPF promotes equal treatment and opportunities between women and men, which should be considered a fundamental aspect of the CIPF’s labor relations and human resources management. In addition, the CIPF is committed to reconcile a work and family life of its employees and are offering the possibility to benefit from flexible working hours. The CIPF is committed to complying with the European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers (EU Charter & Code) by developing its human resources strategy for researchers (HRS4R) and through its open, transparent, and merit-based recruitment policy (OTM-R)

How to apply:

You can find the full official offer [here](). Interested candidate should send their CV, cover letter and contact details for two references. The CV should remove all personal references to gender, age, marital status, nationality and should not include a photograph. You can apply by clicking [here]().
